Both Durham's rule and Curren's rule are significant tests used to determine criminal responsibility in cases where the defendant's mental state is in question.

questions.text: What is the cause of tattooing around the entry wound of a bullet? (INICET NOVEMBER 2022)
questions.solution:
Ans. A. Unburnt particles  

 

  • Tattooing is a term used to describe the punctate abrasions observed when skin comes into contact with partially burned or unburned grains of gunpowder.
  • They are also called stippling or peppering. This is seen up to 50 cm of firing
  • They are seen in near (30-50cm) to mid-range of shooting

 

Firearm injuries:

 

 

Blackening – due to deposit of smoke

 

 

 

Grease collar - due to the deposition of the lubricant of the bullet in the tissues

 

Burn injuries - occur due to flame released during the firing.

 

Other Options:

 

Option B. Smoke: Causes blackening, not tattooing.

 

Option C. Impact: Refers to the force of the bullet causing tissue damage but does not explain tattooing.

 

Option D. Muzzle impression: Occurs when the muzzle of the firearm makes contact with the skin, leaving an impression, but does not cause tattooing.

 

Educational Objective:

 

Tattooing around the entry wound of a bullet is caused by unburnt particles of gunpowder embedding into the skin.

questions.text: Bullet fingerprinting involves? (AIIMS Nov 2018)
questions.solution:
Ans. C. Both

 

Bullet fingerprinting / Ballistic finger printing:

 

  • Investigators using ballistic fingerprinting analyze a fired bullet or casing for scratches under a microscope. The markings, which — like fingerprints — are unique to each weapon, are then compared with those found on bullets used in separate shootings.
  • It involves both primary and secondary markings.

 

A. Primary markings (Class characteristics) occurs because bullet is slightly larger than the barrel. The primary markings are determined by Class characteristics are determined by manufacturing specifications, design and dimensions. They are most useful in identifying the make and model of the gun involved. Class characteristics in fired bullet identification would be:

 

i. Number, diameter and width of lands and grooves

ii. Depth of grooves

iii. Direction and degree of rifling twist

 

B. Secondary Markings (individual / accidental characteristics): These are formed due to Irregularities (imperfections) on the inner surface of barrel itself which are specific for that particular weapon. These irregularities are produced by sticking of particles of the bullet to the bore when shots are fired and is known as metallic fouling. They also result accidentally during the manufacturing process, usually microscopic in nature and have random distribution. They are useful in identifying the specific gun which was fired.

 

Educational Objective:

 

Bullet fingerprinting utilizes both primary and secondary markings to identify a bullet, making it a comprehensive approach to forensic analysis in firearm-related investigations.

questions.text:
Identify the findings in freshwater drowning? (INICET Nov 2020)

  1. Hemodilution

  2. Hypokalemia

  3. Hyponatremia

  4. Arrhythmia
questions.solution:
Ans. D. 1, 3, 4

 

Rather than hypokalemia, there is an increase in potassium levels due to the release of intracellular potassium from swollen red blood cells. Hypokalemia is not typically a finding in freshwater drowning.

 

1. Haemodilution: Due to the excessive absorption of water through the alveolar-capillary membrane, the blood becomes diluted.

 

3. Hyponatremia: Haemodilution leads to a decrease in the concentration of sodium in the blood.

 

4. Arrhythmia: Electrolyte abnormalities caused by the haemodilution and resultant imbalance can lead to cardiac arrhythmias.

 

Educational Objective:

 

In cases of freshwater drowning, we see

 

  • Hemodilution – Due to excessive fluid absorption

  • Hyponatremia – Due to hemodilution

  • Arrythmia – Due to electrolyte abnormalities

  • Hyperkalemia -Due to release of intracellular potassium from swollen RBCs

choices.text: In Africanoids the cusps of molars are wide and deep with shovel shaped cusps in incisors
Upper third molar is most commonly absent in Mongolians
Prominent lingual ridge and labial ridge in mongols

questions.text: Identify the false statement regarding teeth and ethnicity?
questions.solution:
Ans. A. In Africanoids the cusps of molars are wide and deep with shovel shaped cusps in incisors

 

The cusps of molars are wide and deep and cusps of incisors are shovel-shaped is typically seen in Mongoloid races not in Africanoids hence the statement is incorrect. In Africanoids there is presence of large teeth and often have more cusps on their molars, even up to eight, with two lingual cusps on the mandibular first premolars as an additional common finding.

 

Option B), Option C), Option D): these statements are correct as explained in the core concept above. The question is asking for the wrong statement.

 

Educational Objective:

 

Key differences between race

choices.text: Fracture of the base of the skull

questions.text: A man is working in an industry without wearing a helmet. A heavy hammer falls on his head due to slipping from the head of his colleague working on the top floor. The X-ray is shown below. What is the diagnosis?(FMGE JULY 2023)
questions.solution:
Ans. A) Depressed Fracture

 

A depressed fracture occurs when a heavy object with a small striking surface impacts the skull, causing a localized depression. In this scenario, the heavy hammer is the object that creates such a fracture. The X-ray provided shows a depression in the skull, indicative of a depressed fracture.

 

Note –

 

Ping Pong #/Ponds #/ Intended # - (a type of depressed #) This is a smooth concave depression without a fracture line, resulting from in-buckling of skull, occurring only in the elastic skull of infants.

 

Gutter # - Long narrow depressed #; It is formed when part of the thickness of the bone is removed so as to form a gutter, e.g. oblique bullet wounds.

 

Other Options:

 

Option B. Linear Fracture/ primary #/ Fissured #: This type of fracture is a simple break in the bone, typically caused by a broad surface impact, such as falling on the ground. It is not usually caused by a hammer.

 

Option C. Fracture of the base of the skull: This type of fracture occurs in severe trauma situations, like road traffic accidents, esp. motorcyclists. Types are -

 

  • Ring # - fall from height; # around foramen magnum
  • Motorcyclist # / Hinge # - skull is divided into anterior and posterior half
  • Spider web #/ Mosaic #/ Comminuted # - Multiple # of skull

 

Option D. Sutural Fracture (Diastatic Fracture): This type occurs in children below three years of age when the sutures of the skull separate. It is not relevant to the described scenario of an adult in an industry.

 

 

Educational Objective:

 

A heavy object with a small striking surface, such as a hammer, typically causes a depressed fracture in the skull. ​

questions.text: Identify the plant shown in the image below and the condition it is responsible for?
questions.solution:
Ans. C) Ergot Poisoning

 

The image shows rye plants infected with ergot, a fungal disease caused by Claviceps purpurea. This fungus produces toxic alkaloids known as ergot alkaloids, which can lead to ergotism or ergot poisoning when ingested.

 

Ergot poisoning typically manifests with two types of symptoms:

 

  1. Convulsive ergotism: characterized by seizures, muscle spasms, and hallucinations.
  2. Gangrenous ergotism: due to vasoconstriction, leading to poor circulation, and gangrene in the extremities.

 

Historically, ergotism has been associated with contaminated rye bread.

 

Other Options:

 

Option A. Opioid Poisoning: Incorrect. Opioid poisoning is caused by substances like morphine or heroin and typically presents with CNS depression, miosis, and respiratory depression, not related to ergot-infected rye.

 

Option B. Cannabis Poisoning: Incorrect. Cannabis poisoning involves symptoms like delirium, euphoria, and hallucinations but is not associated with ergot-infected plants.

 

Option D. Dhatura Poisoning: Incorrect. Dhatura poisoning involves anticholinergic symptoms like delirium, dry mouth, mydriasis, and hallucinations, which are unrelated to ergot poisoning.

 

Educational Objective:

 

Students should recognize that ergot poisoning arises from consuming rye or other grains infected by the fungus Claviceps purpurea, and it can result in severe vasoconstrictive and neurologic symptoms.

choices.text: Tingling and numbness of hands and feet

questions.text: Amongst the options given below, which of these are not seen in cocaine poisoning? (INICET May 2022)
questions.solution:
Ans. B. Constricted pupils and bradycardia

 

Dilated pupils and tachycardia is seen with cocaine ingestion as it is a sympathomimetic (stimulant).

 

Other Options:

 

Option A. Tingling and numbness of hands and feet: This is a common symptom due to the neurological effects of cocaine.

 

Option C. Hypertension: Cocaine causes vasoconstriction and increased heart rate, leading to hypertension.

 

Option D. Hyperthermia: Increased body temperature is a common finding due to excessive sympathetic stimulation.

 

Educational Objective:

 

Features of cocaine intoxication:

 

  • Early features – Stage of excitement:
  • Dry mouth, dysphagia, tachycardia, tachypnea, hypertension, dilated pupils, and increased temperature followed by convulsions, hallucinations, tingling, and numbness in the hands and feet.
  • Late features – Stage of depression – Respiration is depressed, excessive sweating, collapse, convulsions, and death.
  • Magnan’s symptoms / Cocaine bugs - Chronic cocaine users may have the feeling of insects crawling on their skin or the presence of grains of sand under the skin.
  • Ulceration of nasal septum seen due to sniffing cocaine in chronic abuse

choices.text: Skin lesions and bruises of various ages are seen on the body
It occurs due to the tendency of a child to fall repeatedly
The syndrome is a result of gun injuries

questions.text: Identify the true statement from the following about battered baby syndrome? (NEET PG 2019)
questions.solution:
Ans. A) Skin lesions and bruises of various ages are seen on the body

 

Battered child syndrome is defined as the collection of injuries sustained by a child as a result of repeated mistreatment or beating. If a child's injuries indicate intentional trauma or appear to be more severe than could reasonably be expected to result from an accident, battered child syndrome should be suspected.

 

Skin lesions and bruises of different ages (from young to old) are a classical feature of a child with battered baby syndrome.

 

Skeletal survey helps in identifying bone injuries in Battered Baby syndrome.

 

Other Options:

 

Option B. It occurs due to the tendency of a child to fall repeatedly: False: While children do fall frequently, the pattern and severity of injuries in battered child syndrome are inconsistent with typical childhood falls and accidents.

 

Option C. Stab wounds are obvious: False: Stab wounds are not a common feature of battered child syndrome. The syndrome primarily involves bruises, fractures, and other signs of physical abuse.

 

Option D. The syndrome is a result of gun injuries: False: Battered child syndrome is not characterized by gun injuries. It involves repeated physical abuse, leading to various types of trauma, particularly bruises and fractures.

 

Educational Objective:

 

Battered child syndrome is characterized by the presence of skin lesions and bruises of different ages, indicating repeated and ongoing physical abuse.
